bibl.title: Jewish Exegesis and Homeric Scholarship in Alexandria.
bibl.note: Part I. Early Jewish Responses to Homeric Scholarship. See in part. pp. 19-37: 2. A conservative reaction to critical scholarship in the Letter of Aristeas. - Part II. Critical Homeric Scholarship in the Fragments of Philo's Anonymous Colleagues. - Part III. The Inversion of Homeric Scholarship by Philo.
bibl.seg: 241 Alexandrie 364 Aristeae Epistula Homeri Commentatores Homerus
Niehoff Maren R., Jewish Exegesis and Homeric Scholarship in Alexandria.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2011, 8°, xiv-222 pp. ISBN 978-1-107-00072-8. £50.

Part I. Early Jewish Responses to Homeric Scholarship. See in part. pp. 19-37: 2. A conservative reaction to critical scholarship in the Letter of Aristeas. - Part II. Critical Homeric Scholarship in the Fragments of Philo's Anonymous Colleagues. - Part III. The Inversion of Homeric Scholarship by Philo.
